description: The Committee on Ethics has an immediate opening for a Staff Assistant. This position requires an individual who is non-partisan and can handle highly sensitive information.
responsibilities: Assisting with the tracking and processing of committee correspondence
Providing administrative support in the setup of committee meetings
qualifications: Excellent organizational skills and professional telephone manner
Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
Ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
Ability to use good judgment in responding to inquiries and requests
Flexibility in assisting with daily tasks and projects
how_to_apply: Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter by email to Ethicsjobs@mail.house.gov.

description: U.S. Rep. Lloyd Doggett (D-Texas) seeks a press secretary for his Washington office. Spanish skills and Hill experience a plus.
qualifications: Spanish skills a plus
Hill experience a plus
how_to_apply: Send resume, brief writing sample, and three references to DoggettJobs@mail.house.gov. No drop-ins please.

office: Senior Member of the Bay Area California Delegation
description: to assume the responsibilities of managing the front office. Daily tasks include answering telephones; organizing tours; greeting visitors; processing flag requests; assisting legislative staff; and serving as Intern Coordinator.
qualifications: detail-oriented professionals
strong organizational skills and writing abilities
positive attitudes
pride in their work product
Applicants with ties to the Bay Area are strongly encouraged to apply
how_to_apply: Please e-mail cover letter and resume to StaffAssistantCalifornia@gmail.com. No phone calls, e-mails or walk-ins, please.

description:
The Joint Committee on Taxation is seeking an entry level IT support professional to join our Information Technology staff in a Desktop Support role. The Desktop Support Technician provides support to end users on a wide range of issues by identifying, researching, and resolving technical problems.

A day in the Desktop Support life may include:
responsibilities: Responding to all inquiries for technical support same day or next business day while documenting, tracking, and monitoring all issues to ensure a timely resolution.
Installing or supporting any of the following:
Mobile devices such as iPhones and iPads
Create new users and set up workstations for new staff
Maintaining the IT equipment and printer supply
Providing support and responding to issues for staff working remotely
qualifications: Associates degree in information technology or certifications such as CompTIA A+, CompTIA Network+, CompTIA Security+, Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) or the equivalent
Strong technical background with a broad range of technologies including one or more of the following:
Active Directory
Desktop Windows OS 7 â€“ 10
Hardware Setup and Configuration (Computers, Printers, Etc.)
General networking knowledge
MS Office
Mac OS
Mobile Devices including iOS
A person of the highest character and probity

description: Responsibilities include maintaining member's daily and long term schedule in Washington, evaluating meeting requests and invitations, coordinating travel arrangements, managing member's personal correspondence, and ensuring timely preparation for the member for meetings and events. The ideal candidate for this position is detail oriented and proactive, possess strong communication skills, and can thrive in a fast paced and team oriented office. Prior scheduling experience is preferred, as are Connecticut ties and access to a car.
responsibilities: Maintaining member's daily and long term schedule in Washington
Ensuring timely preparation for the member for meetings and events
qualifications: Detail oriented and proactive
Possess strong communication skills
Can thrive in a fast paced and team oriented office
Prior scheduling experience is preferred
Connecticut ties
Access to a car
how_to_apply: Please submit a resume and cover letter to CT02JOB@mail.house.gov. No calls or drop-ins.

office: Senior Democratic House member from CA
description: Seeks proactive, experienced Communications Director to develop and implement strategic media plan in a fast-paced and results-driven environment.
qualifications: Must have proven track-record, and ability to manage website and social media tools.
Outstanding writing skills and strong pitching skills are required.
Southern California ties are preferred but not necessary.
This is not an entry level position.
how_to_apply: Qualified candidates should submit resume, cover letter to commstafferCA2016@gmail.com.
